    • Constructor Detail

      • Parameters

        public Parameters()

        Constructs a Parameters Object.

      • Parameters

        public Parameters(int tStamp,
                  double size,
                  double gen)

        It creates an instance of Parameters. It is used in covering

        Parameters:
        tStamp - is the current time of the system.
        size - is the action set size
        gen - is the generality of the classifier.

      • Parameters

        public Parameters(Parameters p1,
                  Parameters p2,
                  int tStamp)

        It creates a new parameter object making a crossover between the parents parametres.

        Parameters:
        p1 - is the object that contain the parameters for the first parent.
        p2 - is the object that contain the parameters for the second parent.
        tStamp - is the current time stamp.

      • Parameters

        public Parameters(Parameters p,
                  int tStamp)

        Copy constructor Constructs a Parameters Object initializing its attributes from another Parameters object.

        Parameters:
        p - is the origin of the copy.

      • Parameters

        public Parameters(java.util.StringTokenizer t)

        Constructs a Parameters Object initializing its attributes

        Parameters:
        t - contains the information to initialize the parameters object.

    • Method Detail

      • updateParameters

        public void updateParameters(double P,
                             double microClSum)

        Updates the parameters of a classifier (reinforcement component)

        Parameters:
        P - is the payoff of the current iteration (P = reward + gamma * maxPrediction)
        microClSum - is the numerosity of the action set (all the action set.).

      • updateFitness

        public void updateFitness(double kSum,
                          double k)

        Updates the fitness of a classifier

        Parameters:
        kSum - is the sum of all accuracies.
        k - is the accuracy of the classifier.

      • getCompTime

        public int getCompTime()

        Returns the time of the classifier. The difference between timeOfCl and tComp is that the last one is used to the "new reduction" algorithm, while "timeOfCl" is the usual time stamp of XCS

        Returns:
        an integer with the time stamp of the classifier.

      • deletionVote

        public double deletionVote(double avFitness)

        Returns the probability of a classifier to be deleted.

        Parameters:
        avFitness - is the average fitness of the set.
        Returns:
        a double with the probability of being deleted.

      • couldSubsume

        public boolean couldSubsume()

        Indicates if the classifier can subsume. The classifier has to be sufficiently accurate and sufficiently experienced to subsume another classifier.

        Returns:
        a boolean indicating if the classifier can subsume.

      • couldReduce

        public boolean couldReduce(double maxReward)

        Indicates if the classifier is experienced, and accurate enough to be in the reduction set. Otherwise, the classifier will not be included in the reduction

        Parameters:
        maxReward - is the maximum reward of the environment.
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating if the classifier can be in the reduction set.

      • couldComp

        public boolean couldComp()
        Indicates if the classifier is accurate and experienced enough to not be removed from the population

      • addUsefulTimes

        public void addUsefulTimes(int num)
        Adds the given value to the usefulTimes parameter of the classifier
        Parameters:
        num - is the value that has to be added

      • print

        public void print(java.io.PrintWriter fout)

        Prints the classifier to the specified file.

        Parameters:
        fout - is the file output where the parameters have to be printed.
